results.title: The Outsiders
results.creator_credit: Zoetrope Studios, Warner Bros Pictures, Pony Boy, Fred Roos, Gray Frederickson and Francis Ford Coppola
results.brief_description: The first of two films made by Coppola in 1983 and based on novels by youth fiction writer S.E. Hinton (‘The Outsiders’ was her first novel, published when she was just seventeen). Like ‘Rumble Fish’, ‘The Outsiders’ was a rites-of-passage novel that focused on the lives of disenfranchised urban male youth. Set in 1966 in Tulsa, Oklahoma, it follows the lives of the members of two rival teenage street gangs; the middle-class Greasers and the working-class Socs. When Ponyboy, the youngest of three orphaned boys who hang out with the Greasers, and his friend Johnny, are involved in a deadly confrontation with the Socs one night, the two are forced to hide out and reconsider the direction their lives are taking. Cast includes Matt Dillon, Ralph Macchio, Patrick Swayze, Rob Lowe, Emilio Estevez, Tom Cruise and Tom Waits. Original music by Carmine Coppola.

results.title: The Outlaw Josey Wales
results.creator_credit: Malpaso Company, Robert Daley and Clint Eastwood
results.brief_description: Josey Wales (Clint Eastwood) becomes physically and emotionally scarred when Union gorillas murder his family and destroy his Missouri farm. Turning vigilante and ending up with a price on his head, he journeys to Texas and becomes a much-feared Confederate raider. Wales becomes the unwilling centre of a loose community when he picks up survivors of a wagon train ambushed by Comancheros (engagingly played by an excellent supporting cast which includes Sondra Locke). Ultimately, Wales can’t bring himself to leave his motley surrogate family unprotected. Eastwood had not intended to direct as well as star in his twenty-sixth feature film. The directorial assignment had been given to co-writer Phil Kaufman who exited from the picture early on during location shooting and Eastwood, taking over, performed a first-rate job. The film also received an Academy Award nomination for music.

results.title: The Other sister
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Mario Iscovich, Alex Rose and Garry Marshall
results.brief_description: When a mentally challenged young woman returns home from an institution, she craves independence not willingly granted by her loving but overprotective mother. After meeting a mentally handicapped man, Carla experiences romance and the desire for a life unencumbered by others’ limited expectations of her. Cast includes Juliette Lewis, Diane Keaton, Tom Skerritt, Giovanni Ribisi, Poppy Montgomery, Juliet Mills.

results.title: The Opposite of sex
results.creator_credit: Rysher Entertainment, David Kirkpatrick, Michael Besman and Don Roos
results.brief_description: Christina Ricci stars as 16 year old Dedee Truitt, a teenage Lolita with a caustic tongue and scrupulous libido. ‘The Opposite of Sex’ opens with Dedee running away from her white trash mother to go and stay with her well to do gay half brother Bill (Martin Donovan), and his hunky not too bright boyfriend, Randy (William Lee Scott). Soon enough the malicious vamp has turned everyones life upside down, taking off with her brothers boyfriend and his dead ex-lovers ashes. Writer and director Don Roos has fashioned a sharp witty film which inventively uses Dedee’s voice over narration to plead her case to the audience and to confound our expectations of what she might possibly be thinking next. Ricci is wonderfully droll and jaded in the title role but not to be undone is Lisa Kudrow as the bitter and suspicious sister of Bill’s dead lover. Cast also includes Lyle Lovett, Ivan Sergei, Johnny Galecki

results.title: The Omen
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Harvey Bernhard and Richard Donner
results.brief_description: In a moment of grief American Diplomat Robert Thorn (Gregory Peck) swaps his stillborn son with a newly born orphan, unbeknownst to his wife, Katherine (Lee Remick). What they both don’t know however is that the child was born at 6am, on the 6th day, of the 6th month (666), fulfilling a prophecy in the Bible that the coming of Armageddon will begin with the birth of Satan’s son. As their son, Damien (Harvey Stephens), grows older, it becomes apparent that this is no ordinary child. Sure enough, evil nannies, vicious dobermans and tormented priests begin to plague the family, while mysterious and gruesome deaths occur around the boy. This popular film spawned two sequels (“Damien: Omen 2” and “The Final conflict”). This 25th anniversary edition contains a documentary on the making of the film called “666: The Omen revealed”, a feature called “Curse or coincidence” about the mysterious incidents surrounding its production, interview clips and the original theatrical trailer. Cast also includes David Warner, Billie Whitelaw and Holly Palance.

results.title: The Odd couple
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Howard W. Koch and Gene Saks
results.brief_description: Based on the Neil Simon play, Walter Matthau and Jack Lemmon star in this offbeat comedy about two divorced men who try to share an apartment in New York without killing each other. Lemmon plays the irritating Felix Unger, obsessive and fussy, who proves that cleanliness is not a virtue, but a mental illness! Matthau, plays the slob Oscar Madison, who wreaks havoc on a room with the speed and thoroughness of a tornado. The performances are excellent, and the precision timing of the two actors infuses the film with a sense of spontaneity.

results.title: The Odd Angry Shot
results.creator_credit: Samson Productions, Sue Milliken and Tom Jeffrey
results.brief_description: John Jarratt plays a young man who enlists to serve in Vietnam. The film follows him as he serves active duty in one of the toughest of army units - the Australian Special Air Service. In between the savagery of combat the men of the unit gamble, play tricks on each other and drink a numbing amount of alcohol. This hard-edged comedy is a celebration of the Australian male ethos of larrikinism. Amid both the horror and tedium of war, it is only the mens’ sense of humour that saves them from descending into madness. One of the few Australian features to deal directly with Australian combat in Vietnam, “The Odd Angry Shot” features an excellent cast including John Hargreaves, Bryan Brown, Graeme Blundell and Graham Kennedy. Based on the novel by William Nagle.

results.title: The Nutty professor
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Ernest D Glucksman and Jerry Lewis
results.brief_description: Professor Julius F. Kelp (Jerry Lewis), is a chemistry teacher in a large university. Tired of being pushed around and humiliated, he dedicates himself to finding a scientific solution to his problem and discovers a chemical formula that transforms him from a clumsy, shy weakling into an irresistable, dynamic individual, called Buddy Love. However the potion often wears off at inappropriate times with embarrassing and hilarious results. Julius finds himself juggling a hectic doublelife, meek chemistry professor by day, local celebrity and heart throb by night. Inevitably these two worlds collide. Written and directed by Jerry Lewis, this madcap comedy is a swinging combination of farce, slapstick and romance.

results.title: The Nun's story
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Henry Blanke and Fred Zimmerman
results.brief_description: This story begins in 1930 with Sister Luke’s (Audrey Hepburn) journey from postulant to nun. Of her solemn vows of poverty, chastity, silence and obedience, Sister Luke knows the last will be the most difficult to achieve. Her strong will and intellectual pride, qualities destined to make her a brilliant nurse, threaten to undermine her holy calling. Unable to be obedient to her heart, Sister Luke comes perilously close to breaking. Highlighted by Audrey Hepburn’s performance, this film received eight Academy Award Nominations and also stars, Peter Finch, Dame Edith Evans, Dame Peggy Ashcroft, Dean Jagger and Mildred Dunnock.

results.title: The Nugget
results.creator_credit: Film Finance Corporation Australia, Macquarie Film Corporation, b j films, Bill Bennett and Jennifer Cluff
results.brief_description: Lotto, Wookie and Sue are three working class mates whose favourite pastime is to frolic in the outback on a futile hunt for gold, dodging the protestations of their spouses. One day however luck befalls the hapless trio when they happen upon a giant nugget of gold, making them instantly rich. Avarice soon takes over and former rock-solid friendships are torn asunder by rivalries and petty disagreements. Bill Bennett (Kiss or Kill, Spider and Rose) borrows from the set-up of John Huston’s “The Treasure of the Sierra Madre” (1948) but inverts the drama in favour of slapstick comedy, trading on Aussie movie cliches (redneck attitudes, colloquial banter, ockerism, boozing, mateship) familiar themes from such comedies as “The Castle”, “Welcome to Woop, Woop”, “Muriel’s wedding” and even “They’re a weird mob” to create an allegorical fable about the perils of wealth cast in a fun, lightweight, albeit highly predictable, manner.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Finance Corporation Australia, Macquarie Film Corporation, b j films, Bill Bennett and Jennifer Cluff
